poem:
Title: "In a World of Voices"

In the clamoring cacophony of Capitol Hill,
there's a PhD bestowed for discerning the shrill.
"Expertise," she proclaims, like a crow in the wind,
while millions keep dreaming of a world without sin.
Parading untruths, sowing fictional strife,
How many breaths, dear Greene, equates a life?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Marjorie Taylor Greene claims ‘bullshit’ as expert says Covid vaccine saved 14m lives Responding to an expert’s statement that “about 3.2 million” American lives have been saved by vaccines against Covid, with “over 14 million lives” saved globally, the far-right Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene said: “I’m not a doctor, but I have a PhD in recognising bullshit when I hear it.” On Capitol Hill on Thursday, Greene attended a hearing staged by the House oversight". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
